visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing monthly temperature trends over 2023 using a logarithmic scale for temperature variance
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series variables tracking monthly temperatures (μ=18.3°C, σ=8.1 for averages; μ=25.8°C, σ=8.4 for record highs) across 2023. Synthetic data incorporates seasonal progression (winter-summer-winter cycle) and a 10:1 ratio between extreme and moderate values, justifying logarithmic scaling. The line chart format optimizes Tufte's data-ink ratio by eliminating markers and using minimal gridlines. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through distinct dashed/orange and solid/blue encoding with position-aligned labeling. The logarithmic axis preserves visual resolution of lower-temperature variations while accommodating summer peaks, validated by sequential value doubling from January to July.
